smell_analysis.justification: The diagram 'Saali elutsüklid (transformed)' on page 18 is empty, containing no elements inside the package/diagram frame.
All use cases in the diagram on page 2 are associated with actors or linked via include relationships.
No duplicate use case names describing the same activity were found associated with the same actor.
No multiple model elements with the same name were found within the same package.

No redundant data copies were found. While multiple classifier tables (e.g., Riik, Saali_tüüp) share column names like 'nimetus' and 'on_aktiivne', they store distinct domain data, not redundant copies of the same values.
Use case naming is consistent; all use cases on page 2 start with a verb (e.g., 'Vaata', 'Tuvasta', 'Lõpeta', 'Registreeri').
In the state diagram on page 11, all states (Ootel, Aktiivne, etc.) appear reachable through the defined transitions from the 'Alg' state.
In the activity diagrams on pages 3 and 4, all actions are reachable via the control flow.
Relationships in class and database diagrams (e.g., page 5, 6, 17) generally define multiplicities (e.g., 1, 0..*, 0..1) where applicable.
The use case diagram 'Saalide funktsionaalne allsüsteem' on page 2 contains 11 central use case elements (ovals), which exceeds the limit of fewer than 10.
No single class or table was found to have 6 or more visual connection lines on a single diagram page. The 'Saal' table on page 17 has 5 connections.
The layout appears standard with no related elements placed excessively far apart compared to the average distance.
All use cases and activity actions start with active verbs (e.g., 'Vaata', 'Lõpeta', 'Otsi').
No central elements with names of 3 or fewer characters were found (shortest names like 'Isik' and 'Riik' are 4 characters).
Class names (e.g., Isik, Saal, Töötaja) start with capital letters and are singular.

In the 'Saalide register' diagram (page 10) and its transformed version (page 17), the 'Saal' element contains attributes/columns that start with an uppercase letter: 'Kommentaar', 'Laius', 'Pikkus', and 'Tunni_hind'.

No attributes or classes were found using Hungarian notation or type prefixes (e.g., strName). Standard database prefixes like 'PK_', 'FK_' and 'AK_' (for keys/indices) are present but permitted or standard constraint naming.
